metadata.Title: CVE-2023-33203 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - low.
metadata.Description:
The Linux kernel before 6.2.9 has a race condition and resultant use-after-free in drivers/net/ethernet/qualcomm/emac/emac.c if a physically proximate attacker unplugs an emac based device. It was discovered that the Qualcomm EMAC ethernet driver in the Linux kernel did not properly handle device removal, leading to a user-after free vulnerability. A physically proximate attacker could use this to cause a denial of service (system crash) or possibly execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-33203` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.2.0-23-generic - 6.2.0-23.23
linux-image-6.2.0-23-generic-lpae - 6.2.0-23.23
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-23-generic - 6.2.0-23.23
linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-23-generic-64k - 6.2.0-23.23
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1005-aws - 6.2.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.2.0-1005-azure - 6.2.0-1005.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in lunar was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '6.2.0-23.23').
linux-allwinner: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of life, was needed').
